duties_responsibilities.duty: Counsel and aid patients and their families to understand healthcare recommendations and options.
Conduct comprehensive and on-going identification of needs such as healthcare, social, and education.
Advocate and refer patients to appropriate community resources.
Develop care plans for identified patients in coordination with care teams.
Provide education and materials for patients related to general health and caring for families.
Participate in community outreach activities to support Health Equity activities and priorities.
Support Mobile Medicine efforts by providing resource navigation and front office support.
Support equitable distribution of supplies, clothing, hygiene items, and seasonal needs to those in need.
Create and maintain relationships with local agencies serving various patient populations aligned with Health Equity priorities.
Support student rotations in different outreach activities.
Perform other duties as assigned in support of the CHAS Health Mission and Core Values.

education_certification.credential: One year of health and/or social experience. Valid driver’s license and insurance required. BLS/CPR card required within 90-days of hire.
Experience working with community resources such as meal sites, shelters preferred.
Bachelor's degree in Health Science, Social Work, or related field (Master's preferred)
